byline.contributor: Katrin Bennhold reported from Munich, and Melissa Eddy from Berlin.
byline.original: By KATRIN BENNHOLD and MELISSA EDDY

abstract: Germany manages to quickly process and distribute thousands of refugees across country thanks to efficient bureaucracy and decades-old quota system similar to one proposed for European Union by Chancellor Angela Merkel.
lead_paragraph: Germany is in many ways a laboratory of how the European Union could jointly tackle the migrant crisis, and key to the response so far has been a quota system that has been in place for decades.

headline.main: German Quota System Highlights Possible Path and Pitfalls for Handling Crisis
headline.print_headline: German Quota System Highlights Possible Path and Pitfalls for Handling Crisis

snippet: Germany is in many ways a laboratory of how the European Union could jointly tackle the migrant crisis, and key to the response so far has been a quota system that has been in place for decades.

keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
